generalHelpTips.title: General
generalHelpTips.description: Provides help topics on how to use the description wizard. Each entry (under properties) consists of a 'title' for the information title, 'content' for the body of the message.

properties.title: Purpose
properties.content:
The description wizard is an user interface (UI) component that eases the task of metadata attribution of datafiles. The wizard provides the following key features:
  1. Sequence of steps/stages, with intuitive UI forms/controls, to guide the user through the description task
  2. Support for individual and, more interestingly, batch ('bundle') descriptions of datafiles
  3. Cloning/inheriting of metadata

properties.title: Describing Datafiles
properties.content: Select the files to be described in the 'Files in COPO' pane, and click on the 'Describe' button. The target files will be added to the 'Description Wizard' pane. Go ahead and follow the steps in the wizard, supplying requested metadata in each step presented.

properties.content: Select the files to be described in the 'Files in COPO' pane, and click on the 'Describe' button. The target files will be added to the 'Description Wizard' pane. Go ahead and follow the steps in the wizard, supplying requested metadata in each step presented.

fileListComponent.title: Inspect
fileListComponent.description: Provides help topics on how to use the description wizard. Each entry (under properties) consists of a 'title' for the information title, 'content' for the body of the message.

properties.title: Overview
properties.content:
The 'Inspect' pane displays a list of files, uploaded to COPO, with corresponding metadata (e.g., size, type, description).

Actions buttons are available to facilitate interactions with datafiles uploaded to COPO. Buttons are categorised, depending on the impact context, as follows:

  1. The 'global' action buttons, positioned at the top of the table (e.g., Describe), perform specified tasks on one or many selected datafiles.
  2. The 'local' action buttons, displayed as smaller icons (e.g., ) beside individual records, perform tasks that would potentially impact a single (target) record.
The following action buttons are available:
  1. Describe: Initiates the metadata attribution (description) wizard for the selected datafiles or bundle
  2. [Un]Describe: Deletes all previously assigned metadata (via the wizard) to the target datafiles
  3. Select all: Selects or highlights all datafiles displayed (presumably to be acted upon)
  4. Deselect all: Will undo the selection of selected or highlighted datafiles.

properties.title: Supported file types
properties.content:
Our aim is not to provide a list of file formats and/or extensions COPO would necessarily support. However, datafiles uploaded to COPO should potentially be suitable (conforming to formats) for submission to the supported repositories. The following file types/formats should loosely be supported in COPO:
  1. FASTQ to FASTA format (e.g., .fastq, .fastq.gz, .fasta)
  2. PDFs (i.e., .pdf)
  3. Image file formats (e.g., JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP)

properties.title: Datafile Storage timeline
properties.content:
COPO only brokers the submission of data to remote repositories, and is not equipped to act as a 'silo' for datafiles.

Datafiles uploaded to the system are held only for short periods of time (apprx. two weeks), pending deposition of same to remote repositories.

However, given that individual project needs or circumstances may differ considerably, we are more than happy to discuss ways to better support your specific data workflow.
